The expert cited the results of the January 2019 Gallup National Health and Well-Being Index, which reported that 13.7 percent of Americans were uninsured in the last quarter of 2018. This data indicated a 2.8-percentage-point increase since 2016, representing a net increase of about seven million adults without health insurance.
The expert also referred to the figures: which showed that between 2016 and the first nine months of 2018, the number of uninsured individuals rose by 1.3 million according to the National Health Interview Survey.
